p:
In model 1, λ
i, t − 1 is the autoregressive parameter representing the proportion of epidemic cases from the total number of cases for virus type i at time t. When λ
i, t − 1 ≥ 1 (an outbreak occurs) there is an influx of the endemic cases and λ
i, t − 1 < 1 means the process is stable (no outbreak occurs). The ϕ
i, t − 1 quantifies the influence of virus type j on i; η
i, t represents the monthly varying population counts of virus type i at time t (treated as an offset term in the model) and ν
it is the endemic component that explains the baseline incidence rate of cases as subsequently shown in eq. ( 5). The variable y
j, t − 1 denotes the number of cases observed in virus type j at time t − 1. ω
ij is the weighting indicator and is equal to 1 if pathogens j and i have an autoregressive effect on each other and 0 otherwise.
